CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 27, 1945, pg. 9, reads: "Wedding Bells Rang last week for Miss Cora Belle Williams, daughter of Mrs. Mary Williams, and Matthew H. Crawford, son of Mrs. Jennie Crawford, of Beltzhoover. Performed but the Rev. John Douglas Bright, the ceremony attracted a number of out-of-town guests, including those shown above with the bride and groom. Left to right, are: Mrs. Grace Williams, Mrs. Gladys Bullit (former Pittsburgher) and Mrs. Sara Cornell, all of Detroit; the bride and groom; Mrs. Emma Kinney, sister of the bride and Mrs. Steven Cornell of Detroit; Mrs. Lillian Swann of Cleveland and Mrs. Eythel Nichols of Chicago. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Grace Williams, Gladys Bullit, Sara Cornell, groom Matthew H. Crawford and bride Cora Belle Williams Crawford cutting wedding cake, Emma Kinney, Steven Cornell, Lillian Swann, and Eythel Nichols gathered in home, possibly in Beltzhoover
